|publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=9 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|2|18|df=y}} | birth_place = [[The Hague]], Netherlands | height = 1.80 m<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/profile.html/nathan-ake |title=Player Profile: Nathan Aké |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=15 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130224081413/http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/profile.html/nathan-ake |archivedate=24 February 2013}}</ref> | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[AFC Bournemouth]] | clubnumber = 5 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = VV Wilhelmus | youthyears2 = 2003–2007 | youthclubs2 = [[ADO Den Haag]] | youthyears3 = 2007–2011 | youthclubs3 = [[Feyenoord]] | youthyears4 = 2011–2012 | youthclubs4 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | years1 = 2012–2017 | clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps1 = 7 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2015 | clubs2 = → [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] (loan) | caps2 = 5 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2015–2016 | clubs3 = → [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] (loan) | caps3 = 24 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2016–2017 | clubs4 = → [[AFC Bournemouth]] (loan) | caps4 = 10 | goals4 = 3 | years5 = 2017– | clubs5 = [[AFC Bournemouth]] | caps5 = 59 | goals5 = 5 | nationalyears1 = 2009–2010 | nationalteam1 = Netherlands U15 | nationalcaps1 = 5 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2010–2011 | nationalteam2 = Netherlands U16 | nationalcaps2 = 6 | nationalgoals2 = 3 | nationalyears3 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam3 = [[Netherlands national under-17 football team|Netherlands U17]] | nationalcaps3 = 27 | nationalgoals3 = 3 | nationalyears4 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam4 = [[Netherlands national under-19 football team|Netherlands U19]] | nationalcaps4 = 8 | nationalgoals4 = 3 | nationalyears5 = 2013–2016 | nationalteam5 = [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 22 | nationalgoals5 = 2 | nationalyears6 = 2017– | nationalteam6 = [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] | nationalcaps6 = 10 | nationalgoals6 = 1 | club-update = 10:45, 3 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20:42, 16 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Nathan Benjamin Aké''' (born 18 February 1995) is a Dutch professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for English {{English football updater|AFCBourn}} club [[AFC Bournemouth]] and the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands national team]]. Although he predominantly plays as a [[central defender]], he has also been deployed as a [[left back]].<ref name="dailystar1">{{cite news |url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/526529/Chelsea-Transfer-News-Nathan-Ake-Eddie-Howe-Gossip |title=Premier League boss explains why he has signed this Chelsea defender |work=Daily Star |accessdate=14 July 2016}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Chelsea=== ====Early career==== Aké agreed to join the [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] youth system from [[Feyenoord]] in 2011 at age 16.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1340603/Chelsea-lure-15-year-old-Nathan-Ake-spark-Feyenoord-fury.html |title=Chelsea spark Feyenoord fury as Blues lure 15-year-old defender Nathan Ake to London |work=Daily Mail |date=22 December 2010}}{{Unreliable source?|date=May 2017}}</ref> He had played at Feyenoord since age 12 after joining the club from [[ADO Den Haag]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.vvwilhelmus.nl/nieuws/2011/december/nathan-ak%C3%A9,-oud-wilhelmus-jeugd-speler,-definitief-naar-chelsea-fc/ |title=Nathan Aké, oud Wilhelmus Jeugd speler, definitief naar Chelsea FC |publisher=V.V. Wilhelmus |accessdate=16 May 2013 |language=Dutch |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141129063009/http://www.vvwilhelmus.nl/nieuws/2011/december/nathan-ak%C3%A9,-oud-wilhelmus-jeugd-speler,-definitief-naar-chelsea-fc/ |archivedate=29 November 2014}}</ref>
Aké made his [[2012–13 Premier League|Premier League]] debut on 26 December 2012 against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] as a 17-year-old, replacing [[Juan Mata]] in added time at the end of a 1–0 win at [[Carrow Road]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Phillips |first=Owen |title=Norwich 0–1 Chelsea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20779143 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=26 December 2012}}</ref> He made his first start for the club in the [[2012–13 FA Cup|FA Cup]] on 27 February 2013 in a 2–0 win against [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21515665 "Middlesbrough 0–2 Chelsea"] BBC Sport. 27 February 2013. Retrieved 27 February 2013.</ref> He was chosen to start in a defensive midfield position for Chelsea in the second leg of their [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]] quarter-final clash with [[FC Rubin Kazan|Rubin Kazan]] in Russia on 11 April, a match that finished in a 3–2 loss but resulted in a 5–4 aggregate victory.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/apr/11/rubin-kazan-chelsea-europa-league |title=Chelsea struggle to finish off Rubin Kazan but reach semi-finals |work=The Guardian |date=11 April 2013}}</ref> Aké was an unused substitute for Chelsea in the [[2013 UEFA Europa League Final|Europa League final]] against [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] at the [[Amsterdam Arena]] on 16 May, which Chelsea won 2–1.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/sport/football/4929206/Benfica-1-2-Chelsea-Match-report-and-pictures.html |title=Benfica 1 Chelsea 2 |work=The Sun |date=15 May 2013}}</ref> He was voted Chelsea's Young Player of the Year on 16 May,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/javaImages/94/36/0,,10268~11941524,00.jpg |title=Archived copy |accessdate=16 May 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131116205013/http://www.chelseafc.com/javaImages/94/36/0,,10268~11941524,00.jpg |archivedate=16 November 2013}}</ref> and made his first [[Premier League]] start three days later in the 2–1 win against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] on the last matchday of the season.{{citation needed|date=December 2018}}
On 8 August 2013, Aké signed a new five-year contract with Chelsea, lasting until 2018.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3342358/title/new-deal-for-ake |title=New Deal for Aké |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=8 August 2013}}</ref> Following his permanent promotion to the first team, on 21 October 2014, Aké made his [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] debut from the substitutes' bench, coming into the match for [[Cesc Fàbregas]] in the 60th minute during a 6–0 home win over [[NK Maribor|Maribor]], and provided an assist for [[Eden Hazard]]'s second goal.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29362738 |title=Didier Drogba scored his first goal since rejoining Chelsea as they recorded their biggest Champions League win with a dominant victory against Maribor at Stamford Bridge. |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 October 2014 |accessdate=21 October 2014}}</ref>
====Loan spells==== On 25 March 2015, Aké was loaned to Championship club [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] for one month,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/news/article/royals-sign-nathan-ake-on-loan-from-chelsea-2358756.aspx |title=Royals Sign Nathan Ake on Loan |publisher=Reading F.C. |accessdate=25 March 2015}}</ref> making his first of five appearances against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in a 1–1 draw ten days later.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/reading/team-news/team-news-nathan-ake-handed-reading-debut_215094.html |title=Nathan Ake handed Reading debut |website=''Sportsmole.co.uk'' |accessdate=4 April 2015}}</ref> Although he only made one league appearance for Chelsea the entire season, as a substitute in a 3–0 loss at [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on 18 May,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32686137 |title=West Brom inflicted a third league defeat of the season on champions Chelsea in an eventful game at The Hawthorns. |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 May 2015 |accessdate=19 May 2015}}</ref> manager [[José Mourinho]] said Aké would receive a winner's medal for his contribution to the team [[2014–15 Chelsea F.C. season|that season]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/chelsea/story/2450893/jose-mourinho-every-chelsea-player-to-get-prem-medal |title=Every Chelsea player to get a Premier League medal says Jose Mourinho}}</ref>
On 14 August 2015, Aké completed a season-long loan move to newly promoted Premier League side [[Watford F.C.|Watford]],<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/150814-nathan-ake-signs-for-watford-fc-from-chelsea-2619925.aspx |title=OFFICIAL: Aké Joins Hornets On Loan |accessdate=14 August 2015}}</ref> after having signed a new five-year contract with Chelsea.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/08/new-deal-for-ake.html |title=New deal for Aké |accessdate=14 August 2015}}</ref> Eleven days later, he made his debut for the ''Hornets'' in a [[2015–16 Football League Cup|League Cup]] second round match against [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]], which ended in a 1–0 defeat for his side.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33969908 |title=Championship Preston reached round three of the Capital One Cup as Marnick Vermijl's goal saw off Premier League Watford, who finished with 10 men |accessdate=25 August 2015}}</ref> Aké played his first Premier League match coming off the substitutes' bench against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] 19 September 2015, helping the ''Hornets'' hold on for a 2–1 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/09/19/england/premier-league/newcastle-united-football-club/watford-football-club/2043102/ |title=Newcastle United vs. Watford 1 – 2 (9/19/15) |date=19 September 2015}}</ref> He scored his first senior goal on 20 December, opening a 3–0 win over [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] at [[Vicarage Road]] in the fourth minute, after goalkeeper [[Ádám Bogdán]] dropped a corner kick.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Barlow |first1=Matt |title=Watford 3–0 Liverpool: Nathan Ake capitalises on Adam Bogdan howler and Odion Ighalo strikes to condemn Jurgen Klopp's men to defeat as Hornets move a point off the Premier League top four |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3367794/Watford-3-0-Liverpool-Nathan-Ake-capitalises-Adam-Bogdan-howler-Odion-Ighalo-strikes-condemn-Jurgen-Klopp-s-men-defeat-Hornets-point-Premier-League-four.html |accessdate=21 December 2015 |work=Daily Mail |date=20 December 2015}}{{Unreliable source?|date=May 2017}}</ref>
During his time with the ''Hornets'', manager [[Quique Sánchez Flores]] primarily deployed Aké as a left back.<ref name="dailystar1"/> His performance and work ethics earned him the Watford's Young Player of the Season award.<ref name="Watford Award">{{cite news |last1=Barlow |first1=Matt |title=Watford: END OF SEASON AWARDS: Gomes Named 2015/16 Player Of The Season |url=http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/160517-watford-fc-end-of-season-awards-winners-3116857.aspx |accessdate=5 July 2016 |work=Watford Official Site |date=18 May 2016}}</ref>
[[File:Watford v Norwich (8).jpg|thumb|right|150px|Aké during his loan spell at [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]]] On 29 June 2016, Aké joined [[AFC Bournemouth]] on loan for the [[2016–17 A.F.C. Bournemouth season|2016–17 season]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Ake loaned to the Cherries |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/06/ake-loaned-to-the-cherries.html?extcmp=SOCIA_TW_ENG_ARTICLES |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=29 June 2016}}</ref> On 21 August, he made his Bournemouth debut in a 1–0 away defeat against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], replacing [[Jordon Ibe]] following teammate [[Harry Arter]]'s dismissal after a challenge on [[Cheikhou Kouyaté]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=West Ham United 1–0 Bournemouth |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37075120 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 August 2016 |accessdate=21 August 2016}}</ref> Following the defeat to West Ham, Aké made his full debut against [[Morecambe F.C.|Morecambe]] in the [[2016–17 EFL Cup#Second round|second round of the EFL Cup]] on 24 August.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.afcb.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/team-news-morecambe-vs-afc-bournemouth-efl-cup-3270153.aspx |title=Team news: Morecambe vs AFC Bournemouth – Ten changes from West Ham United defeat |date=24 August 2016 |publisher=AFC Bournemouth}}{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> On 19 November, in his first Premier League start, Aké scored his first goal for Bournemouth in a 1–0 away victory over [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37959843 |title=Stoke City 0–1 Bournemouth |date=19 November 2016 |work=BBC Sports}}</ref>
On 4 December 2016, Bournemouth played Liverpool and overturned a 3–1 deficit with 15 minutes to go to win the match 4–3; Aké scoring the winning goal in the 93rd minute minutes, his third Premier League goal and the second against Liverpool.{{citation needed|date=January 2017}}
====Return to Chelsea==== Aké was recalled by Chelsea on 8 January 2017,<ref>{{cite web |title=Nathan Ake: Chelsea recall defender early from Bournemouth loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38544921 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=8 January 2017}}</ref> making his first appearance for the club since the recall on 28 January in a 4–0 [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup]] fourth round victory over fellow West London club [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=Lythell |date=28 January 2017 |accessdate=28 January 2017 |title=Willian leads impressive Chelsea to big FA Cup fourth round win vs. Brentford |work=ESPN FC |url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/club/chelsea/363/blog/post/3048506/willian-leads-impressive-chelsea-to-big-fa-cup-fourth-round-win-vs-brentford}}</ref> He was also selected to start in Chelsea's 2–0 win over [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] in the fifth round of the same competition on 18 February.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38940092 |title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 0–2 Chelsea |date=18 February 2017 |publisher=BBC}}</ref>
On 22 April, Aké started alongside [[David Luiz]] and [[César Azpilicueta]] in central defence in Chelsea's 4–2 FA Cup semi-final victory over rivals [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39604653 |title=Chelsea 4–2 Tottenham |date=22 April 2017 |publisher=BBC}}</ref>
===AFC Bournemouth=== On 30 June 2017, Aké signed a contract with Premier League club AFC Bournemouth on a permanent basis for a club record of £20 million transfer fee, with the player officially re-joining the club the following day, when the 2017 transfer window opened.<ref name="BBC_30Jun2017">{{cite web |title=Nathan Ake: Bournemouth sign Chelsea defender for a club record fee |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40454293 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=30 June 2017 |date=30 June 2017}}</ref> On 21 July, it was reported his former club Chelsea had inserted a buy-back clause for Aké in his transfer contract.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/4068567/buy-back-clause-chelsea-nathan-ake-nathaniel-chalobah-bertrand-traore/ |title=What is a buy-back clause? And have Chelsea inserted them in Nathan Ake, Nathaniel Chalobah and Bertrand Traore deals? |work=The Sun |date=21 July 2017 |accessdate=21 July 2017 |last=Street |first=Sam}}</ref>
==International career== Aké has represented the Netherlands at every youth level since his under-15 debut in 2009, making 54 appearances in total.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/nathan-ake/182930/ |title=N. AKÉ |publisher=Soccerway |accessdate=26 September 2014}}</ref> He has captained both the U17 and the U19 sides. Aké was selected into both squads that won the UEFA European Under-17 Championships in 2011 and 2012 in Serbia and in Slovenia, respectively.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/news/newsid=1796817.html |title=Captain Aké learns from Chelsea stars |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=14 May 2012}}</ref>
Aké was also eligible to represent the [[Ivory Coast national football team|Ivory Coast]] through his father Moise.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2896/premier-league/2017/05/02/35150672/chelsea-star-ake-could-snub-netherlands-for-ivory-coast |title=Chelsea star Ake could snub Netherlands for Ivory Coast |publisher=Goal.com |accessdate=3 May 2017}}</ref>
Aké made his senior international debut in a friendly against [[Morocco national football team|Morocco]], which the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] won 2–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-4560108/Morocco-1-2-Holland-Vincent-Janssen-seals-friendly-win.html |title=Ake makes Holland Debut in Friendly |work=Daily Mail |accessdate=1 June 2017}}</ref>
==Style of play== Aké has been praised for his versatility, being able to play at both full back, centre back and in defensive midfield, which has been attributed to a good work ethic, professionalism and gifted technique. His calmness on the ball and appearance have led to comparisons to former Dutch legend and Chelsea player [[Ruud Gullit]], with his versatility compared to David Luiz.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2278552/Chelsea-youth-player-Nathan-Ake-looks-like-Ruud-Gullit-plays-like-David-Luiz.html |title=Ruud boy: Chelsea youth star Ake is a mini Gullit with his dreadlocks and cool head |work=Daily Mail |accessdate=14 February 2013}}</ref>
Aké said that even though he has played as a defender in recent seasons, he sees himself as a holding midfielder and that his favourite position is in the midfield.<ref name="dailystar1"/>
==Personal life== Aké's father is from the Ivory Coast.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/apr/15/nathan-ake-watford-jose-mourinho-chelsea? |title=Nathan Aké on Watford, Mourinho and the Chelsea loanees’ WhatsApp group |work=The Guardian |accessdate=17 April 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/05/near-and-far--nathan-ake1.html |title=Near and Far: Nathan Ake |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |accessdate=3 May 2017}}</ref> He is teetotal.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jul/30/premier-league-2018-19-preview-bournemouth |title=Premier League 2018–19 preview No 2: Bournemouth |first=Ben |last=Fisher |date=30 July 2018 |website=The Guardian}}</ref>
==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|23 September 2018}}<ref name="Soccerway"/>

Bournemouth season|2016–17]]<ref name=NA16/> |Premier League |10||3||0||0||2||0||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||12||3 |- |rowspan=2|AFC Bournemouth |[[2017–18 A.F.C. Bournemouth season|2017–18]]<ref>{{soccerbase season|68645|2017|accessdate=14 May 2018}}</ref> |Premier League |38||2||1||0||2||0||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||41||2 |- |[[2018–19 A.F.C. Bournemouth season|2018–19]]<ref>{{soccerbase season|68645|2018|accessdate=23 September 2018}}</ref> |Premier League |6||1||0||0||0||0||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||6||1 |- !colspan=3|Total !54!!6!!1!!0!!4!!0!!colspan=2|—!!colspan=2|—!!59!!6 |- !colspan=3 |Career total !90!!7!!9!!0!!7!!0!!3!!0!!0!!0!!109!!7 |} {{notelist}}

==Honours== [[File:Chelsea 2 Bolton Wanderers 1 Chelsea progress to the next round of the Capital One cup (15165130050).jpg|thumb|right|Aké ''(wearing No.6)'' playing for Chelsea against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] in the League Cup; which they went on to win.]]
'''Chelsea'''<ref name=Soccerway>{{Soccerway|nathan-ake/182930}}</ref> *[[EFL Cup|Football League Cup]]: [[2014–15 Football League Cup|2014–15]] *[[UEFA Europa League]]: [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League|2012–13]] <!--DO NOT INCLUDE 2014–15/2016–17 PREMIER LEAGUE, HE DID NOT PLAY ENOUGH MATCHES FOR A MEDAL-->
'''Netherlands U17'''<ref name=Soccerway /> *[[UEFA European Under-17 Championship]]: [[2011 UEFA European Under-17 Championship|2011]], [[2012 UEFA European Under-17 Championship|2012]]
'''Individual''' *[[Chelsea F.C. Reserves and Academy#Young Player of the Year|Chelsea Young Player of the Year]]: [[2012–13 Chelsea F.C. season|2012–13]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/the-club/history/style/statistics/annual-awards.html |title=Chelsea Annual Awards |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> *[[Watford F.C.|Watford]] Young Player of the Season: [[2015–16 Watford F.C. season|2015–16]]<ref name="Watford Award" />
